titleInfo.title: Prism Technologies v. PayPal
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The Report and Recommendation 51 is adopted in its entirety; Cases Nos. 8:08CV195 and 8:08CV196 are deemed related cases pursuantto NEGenR 1.4; VeriSign's Motion to Transfer pursuant to 28 U.S.C. ยง 1404(a) (Filing No. 29 in Case No. 8:08CV195) is granted; PayPal's Motion to Transfer pursuant to 28 U.S.C. ยง 1404(a) 39 in Case No. 8:08CV196) is granted, andCases Nos. 8:08CV195 and 8:08CV196 are transferred to the Northern District of California for all further proceedings pursuant to 28 U.S.C. ยง1404(a). Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (MKR)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - The Report and Recommendation 51 is adopted in its entirety; Cases Nos. 8:08CV195 and 8:08CV196 are deemed related cases pursuantto NEGenR 1.4; VeriSign's Motion to Transfer pursuant to 28 U.S.C. ยง 1404(a) (Filing No. 29 in Case No. 8:08CV195) is granted; PayPal's Motion to Transfer pursuant to 28 U.S.C. ยง 1404(a) 39 in Case No. 8:08CV196) is granted, andCases Nos. 8:08CV195 and 8:08CV196 are transferred to the Northern District of California for all further proceedings pursuant to 28 U.S.C. ยง1404(a). titleInfo.title: Prism Technologies v. PayPal
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - The Court's Order of December 2, 2008, is vacated; The Clerk of the Court is directed to reopen the cases; On or before January 30, 2009, the parties shall file electronically joint stipulations for dismissal (or other dispositive stipulations) and shall submit to District Judge Laurie Smith Camp, at smithcamp@ned.uscourts.gov, a draft order that will fully dispose of the cases. If the cases are being dismissed, then the stipulations shall comply with Fed. R. Civ. P. 41(a)(1), and shall state whether the dismissal is with or without prejudice; and Absent compliance with this order, these cases (including all counterclaims and the like) may be dismissed without further notice in accordance with NECivR 68.1.Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (TCL)

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER - The Court's Order of December 2, 2008, is vacated; The Clerk of the Court is directed to reopen the cases; On or before January 30, 2009, the parties shall file electronically joint stipulations for dismissal (or other dispositive stipulations) and shall submit to District Judge Laurie Smith Camp, at smithcamp@ned.uscourts.gov, a draft order that will fully dispose of the cases. If the cases are being dismissed, then the stipulations shall comply with Fed. R. Civ. P. 41(a)(1), and shall state whether the dismissal is with or without prejudice; and Absent compliance with this order, these cases (including all counterclaims and the like) may be dismissed without further notice in accordance with NECivR 68.1.Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (TCL)

titleInfo.title: Prism Technologies v. PayPal
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER OF DISMISSAL - The parties' Stipulation of Dismissal without Prejudice (Filing No. 56) is approved, and the relief requested therein is granted; The Complaint, as well as all claims and counterclaims in this action are dismissed without prejudice; Any pending motions in the above captioned case are terminated; The parties shall pay their own costs and attorneys fees; and Any future claims brought against PayPal involving either United States Patent No. 5,745,574 or No. 5,850,442 must be filed in the Northern District of California, or will be subject to transfer to that court. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (TCL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER OF DISMISSAL - The parties' Stipulation of Dismissal without Prejudice (Filing No. 56) is approved, and the relief requested therein is granted; The Complaint, as well as all claims and counterclaims in this action are dismissed without prejudice; Any pending motions in the above captioned case are terminated; The parties shall pay their own costs and attorneys fees; and Any future claims brought against PayPal involving either United States Patent No. 5,745,574 or No. 5,850,442 must be filed in the Northern District of California, or will be subject to transfer to that court. Ordered by Judge Laurie Smith Camp. (TCL, )
